org.modelio.vbasic.net

Class ApacheUriConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.modelio.vbasic.net.UriConnection
      • org.modelio.vbasic.net.ApacheUriConnection

  • public class ApacheUriConnection
extends UriConnection
    HTTP/HTTPS URI support using Apache HTTP client library.

                           throws IOException
        Description copied from class: UriConnection
        Same as URLConnection.getInputStream().
        Specified by:
        getInputStream in class UriConnection
        Returns:
        an input stream that writes to this connection.
        Throws:
        UnknownServiceException - if the protocol does not support input.
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the input stream.

      • getOutputStream

        public OutputStream getOutputStream()
                             throws IOException
        Same as URLConnection.getOutputStream().

        This implementation creates a PipedOutputStream to the Apache entity input stream. It is strongly advised to write to the returned stream in another thread.

        Specified by:
        getOutputStream in class UriConnection
        Returns:
        an output stream that writes to this connection.
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs while creating the output stream.
        UnknownServiceException - if the protocol does not support output.
        See Also:
        PipedOutputStream, PipedInputStream

      • setRequestProperty

        public void setRequestProperty(String key,
                               String value)
        Description copied from class: UriConnection
        Same as URLConnection.setRequestProperty(String, String). Sets the general request property. If a property with the key already exists, overwrite its value with the new value.

        NOTE: HTTP requires all request properties which can legally have multiple instances with the same key to use a comma-seperated list syntax which enables multiple properties to be appended into a single property.

        Specified by:
        setRequestProperty in class UriConnection
        Parameters:
        key - the keyword by which the request is known (e.g., "Accept").
        value - the value associated with it.
        See Also:
        URLConnection.setRequestProperty(String, String)

      • setDoOutput

        public void setDoOutput(boolean dooutput)
        Description copied from class: UriConnection
        Same as URLConnection.setDoInput(boolean).

        A URI connection can be used for input and/or output. Set the DoOutput flag to true if you intend to use the URI connection for output, false if not. The default is false.

        Specified by:
        setDoOutput in class UriConnection
        Parameters:
        dooutput - the new value.

      • setDoInput

        public void setDoInput(boolean doinput)
        Description copied from class: UriConnection
        A URI connection can be used for input and/or output. Set the DoInput flag to true if you intend to use the URI connection for input, false if not. The default is true.
        Specified by:
        setDoInput in class UriConnection
        Parameters:
        doinput - the new value.

      • setConnectTimeout

        public void setConnectTimeout(int timeout)
                       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from class: UriConnection
        Sets a specified timeout value, in milliseconds, to be used when opening a communications link to the resource referenced by this URLConnection. If the timeout expires before the connection can be established, a java.net.SocketTimeoutException is raised. A timeout of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

        Some non-standard implementation of this method may ignore the specified timeout. To see the connect timeout set, please call getConnectTimeout().

        Specified by:
        setConnectTimeout in class UriConnection
        Parameters:
        timeout - an int that specifies the connect timeout value in milliseconds
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the timeout parameter is negative
        See Also:
        UriConnection.getConnectTimeout()

      • getConnectTimeout

        public int getConnectTimeout()
        Description copied from class: UriConnection
        Returns setting for connect timeout.

        0 return implies that the option is disabled (i.e., timeout of infinity).

        Specified by:
        getConnectTimeout in class UriConnection
        Returns:
        an int that indicates the connect timeout value in milliseconds
        See Also:
        UriConnection.setConnectTimeout(int)

      • setIfNotStamp

        Description copied from class: UriConnection
        Tells to skip connection if the remote file stamp is the given one.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        See Also:
